bibl.title: Tibullus and Egypt: A Postcolonial Reading of Elegy 1.7.
bibl.note: Tibullus 1.7 embraces a complex audience: as a text that engages Rome's colonial relationship with Egypt at a critical moment, the elegy speaks not only to Roman colonizers but also to a colonized provincial elite, exercising a form of cultural imperialism over a rhetorically constructed Egyptian "Other."
bibl.seg: Bowditch P. Lowell, Tibullus and Egypt: A Postcolonial Reading of Elegy 1.7.

Tibullus 1.7 embraces a complex audience: as a text that engages Rome's colonial relationship with Egypt at a critical moment, the elegy speaks not only to Roman colonizers but also to a colonized provincial elite, exercising a form of cultural imperialism over a rhetorically constructed Egyptian "Other."
